page.title: 14TRAFFIC (1): WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: A traffic survey was carried out on all roads in the block in early May. Between noon and 1 pm. c.{10,000 vehicles made a transit through the area. Approximately 80% of the north-south flows were handled by the {M25.}East-west flows were mostly handled by one of the two{radial {routes}to{London, the A12 or A127.}The {A12}accounted for 38% of the east moving and 40% of the west moving flows, the{A127}41% of the east moving and 40% of the west moving flows. These amounts would vary during the day.{Minor roads}handled considerable flows, however: an average of one car every twelve seconds was passing down Nag's Head Lane (Brook Street to Up- minster), one every ten seconds on the lane from Great Warley to Harold Wood, and{one every eight seconds}on the {B186.
